revised_title: Astronomical Observations on the Planets Venus and Mars: Determining Heliocentric Longitude, Annual Motion of Nodes, and Greatest Inclination of Orbits
tldr: The author, Thomas Bugge, conducts astronomical observations on the planets Venus and Mars to determine their heliocentric longitude, annual motion of nodes, and the greatest inclination of their orbits. The observations were made at the Royal Observatory in Copenhagen using a six-foot transit instrument and a mural quadrant. The results contribute to refining the understanding of planetary orbits and their positions in the solar system.
